alert.note: Alert for Carter (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 2:28PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN CARTER COUNTY THROUGH 315 PM MDT... At 227 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lightning Flat to Aladdin. Movement was north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Alzada, Albion, Hammond, and Ridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern Montana.
